result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:19 AM Defendant Oscar I Perry in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas J McClure Esq in court for Oscar I Perry. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense believes he has discovery, and needs to meet with responsible DA to discuss offer. Defense requests a date in about 30 days. 

Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Thomas J McClure in court, defendant Oscar I Perry not in court, in custody.   
Attorney McClure is willing to waive his client's appearance.

Defense is requesting a new date.
Defense is still waiting on some discovery, further investigation and negotiations with the State.
  Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:11 AM Defendant Oscar I Perry in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas J McClure.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases called for status. 
Defense had requests Huber Bailee status. Due to current circumstances, that is not a viable option.
Defense is looking for a global offer, but anticipates a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form filed by defendant requesting Huber work release while he waits for his cases to resolve.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 5/24/2022 - The defendant will need to work with attorney regarding this request. Attorney McClure may file a bail motion if he wishes.**
Hearing on June 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

File not called on the record.
Attorney Thomas J McClure in court, defendant Oscar I Perry not in court, in custody.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense counsel waives Defendant's appearance.   Atty McClure asks for a date in 30 days to get offer from the State.  Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Unable to forward
Hearing on May 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Oscar I Perry in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas J McClure.   

Defense acknowledges receipt of the information, waives reading and enters a Not Guilty Plea.  Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Arraignment on April 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Oscar I Perry
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 04-08-2022)
Prior: 1220 Prairie Creek Blvd Apt 101, Oconomowoc, WI 53066

08:19 AM Defendant Oscar I Perry in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas J McClure.   Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  Attorney McClure is asking for an arraignment date before the Trial Court.  The Court will set this matter for arraignment before the Trial Court.  Bail remains as fixed.  Arraignment scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing on April 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:55 AM Defendant Oscar I Perry in court by zoom video with attorney Thomas J McClure by zoom video.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Notice of Retainer.

Adjustment Number: 22A 008816,

Hearing on March 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

02:22 PM Defendant Oscar I Perry in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Defendant states he is going to retain attorney McClure. 
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
THE COURT AUTHORIZES THE NEXT APPEARANCE BY ZOOM.  Hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
